description.narrative: By 2016, municipal and community leadersin the territories supported by UNICEF (municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid, Amazon, UNICEF Urban Centers Platform and the 2014 World Cup host cities) are sensitized to promote and support safe and inclusive initiatives that ensure a child-friendly legacy of the sports mega-events by promoting and supporting initiatives on Sport for Development for children and adolescents, with a focus on the reduction of gender disparities participation of children and adolescents inclusion of those disabled and greater appreciation and inclusion of racial and ethnic diversity., which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, governments at national and sub-national levels, media, corporate sector and civil society with increased capacities and knowledge on the most disadvantaged children, contributing to the universalization of Child Rights, supporting specific public policies addressing inequities and prioritizing boys and girls in public budgets.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
"UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)"
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Brazil 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, municipal and community leadersin the territories supported by UNICEF (municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid, Amazon, UNICEF Urban Centers Platform and the 2014 World Cup host cities) are sensitized to promote and support safe and inclusive initiatives that ensure a child-friendly legacy of the sports mega-events by promoting and supporting initiatives on Sport for Development for children and adolescents, with a focus on the reduction of gender disparities; participation of children and adolescents; inclusion of those disabled; and greater appreciation and inclusion of racial and ethnic diversity.

description.narrative: The Rio 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games provided UNICEF the opportunity to strengthen contents and reach of its sports programmes to foster children's access to practice educational, recreational and professional sports on a healthy, safe, nurturing and inclusive environment, better-prepared stakeholders and advocates for quality sporting structures, equipment and policies. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of governmental institutions and civil society sports sector, private sector and media organizations engaged by UNICEF, which are actively promoting promote the right to safe and inclusive sports and to use sports as a tool for social inclusion and protection of children and adolescents

target.value: 2016:120 organizations from diverse key audiences are engaged with UNICEF to promote the right to safe and inclusive sports as well as the use sports for social inclusion and protection of children and ado

actual.value: 2016:A total of 120 governmental institutions and civil society sports sector, private sector and media organizations engaged

title.narrative: Government, sports sector, private sector, media, civil society and the general public in Brazil and beyond borders, are sensitized and proactively supporting initiatives on S4D and CSR to benefit children and adolescents through the practice of safe and inclusive sports at all levels.

target.value: 2016:3 major social mobilization and advocacy campaigns/events to promote sports and play, as a tool to ensure the fulfillment of the rights of children and adolescents, are planned and deployed. Design (r

actual.value: 2016:UNICEF and partners carried out 3 major social mobilization and advocacy campaigns to sensitize government, sports sector, private sector, media, civil society and the public in Brazil and beyond borders to promote sports and play, as a tool to ensure the fulfilment of the rights of children and ado

title.narrative: % of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal providing improved access of children and adolescents to practice safe and inclusive sports

target.value: 2016:50% of Semiarid and Amazon municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal are developing activities at the local level to improve the access of children and adolescents to practice safe and inclusive spor

actual.value: 2016:Info as of December, once the UNICEF Seal cycle is fully completed. Amazon region: 34% Semi-arid region: 41%
